strings.Value: "What's going on?"
"What are the rules of your game?"
[Give 500 gold] "My bet's on Mysteriado."
[Give 500 gold] "My bet's on Zynmyrgya."
[Attack] "You filthy hacks! I'll teach you a lesson!"
"Farewell."
"Don't. And you'd better return that scroll to whomever you 'found' it from."
"Let's not. Being thrown out of the tournament is the last thing we need."
"Do whatever you want."
"Great idea! Go for it!"
"Do it! I hope the scroll has something like fireball or poisonous cloud!"
"Come, come, don't be shy! Witness secrets not meant for mortal eyes! An aetherial battle within a vortex of the supernatural! Bets here — place your bets!"

"Oooh, something special indeed! I'd wager you've never seen the like! Before your eyes unfolds an epic battle between the world's greatest spellcasters — Mysteriado, the Devil Tamer of {g|Cheliax}Cheliax{/g}, versus Zynmyrgya, Magistress of the {g|Irrisen}Irrisen{/g} Witches! Who will win? Who would you bet on?"

"You think this just a game? I wouldn't be so sure! The rules for you are simple enough, though — choose one of the spellcasters, and place your bet. If you guess the winner, you double your wager! If you're wrong, the gold is mine."
"Bets are set — no more bets! Let the battle commence!"
"Help! Guards! Guards!"
"Thank you! Please enjoy the tournament."
"Oh, it's you! My apologies, but I'm afraid you're just too lucky. My pockets are empty — you won all I had! So I can't accept any more bets — though you can still enjoy the battle!"

{n}Octavia moves very close to you and, barely suppressing her laughter, whispers,{/n} "Some charlatans, huh? Can I teach them a lesson? I... 'found' an interesting scroll here. Shall we see how they like it?"
"Ugh, you're so bloodthirsty! No, it's nothing like that — just a harmless joke... Look!"
"You're such a bore! It's a holiday, have some fun for once in your life! Come on, smile!"
{n}Octavia giggles.{/n} "Let's see what happens!"
